title: Supreme Court Debates Pennsylvania Law Opening Courts to Suits Against Companies
description: A novel Pennsylvania law requires corporations that do business in the state to consent to being sued there, even if the suits have nothing to do with the state.
dc:creator: Adam Liptak
media:credit: Shuran Huang for The New York Times
media:description: If the Supreme Court rules the Pennsylvania law constitutional, other states would most likely enact similar ones.
